textAfterTable: 13 Songs Customer Reviews virgil fox encores           by kate brannen Of all the organ albums and compilations I have heard, this is by far my favorite. Virgil Fox had a flair for bringing out the dramatic in the selections he played. This album is a wonderfully diverse collection of composers and styles, and an excellent choice for someone just getting in to organ music for the first time or a longtime lover of the sound. Biography Born: May 3, 1912 in Princeton, IL Genre: Classical Years Active: '30s, '40s, '50s, '60s, '70s Virgil Fox was one of the most popular and accomplished classical organists of his time. He often generated controversy because of his flamboyant performance style, which involved the use of lights during live performances and often liberal changes to the scores he was playing.
